description: From Hindi बन्द-ओ-बस्त (band-o-bast) and Urdu بند و بست‎ (band-o-bast), from Persian بند و بست‎ (band-o-bast, “tying and binding”).

entries.meaning: (India) A system or discipline; organisation, arrangement, preparation.
examples: He was proud of his faculty of organisation—what we call bundobust.
